cards.a: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.

cards.q: How do you link a CSS file to an HTML document?
cards.a: By using the <link> tag with the 'rel' attribute set to 'stylesheet' in the <head> section.
A CSS selector specifies which HTML elements the style rules apply to.

cards.q: What symbol is used for ID selectors in CSS?
cards.a: The # symbol is used for targeting element IDs.

cards.q: How do you write a class selector in CSS?
cards.a: Use a period (.) before the class name, e.g., .classname
The 'color' property changes the color of text.

cards.q: How do you set a background color?
What is the default display property for a <div>?
cards.a: 'block' is the default display value for a <div>.

cards.q: How do you make text bold in CSS?
What is the use of the 'margin' property?
cards.a: Margin creates space outside an element's border.
